objectCreation.text: {0} creates a new instance of {1} which is never used. Pass the instance as an argument to another method, assign the instance to a variable, or remove the object creation if it is unnecessary.

stringReturnValue.text: {0} calls {1} but does not use the new string instance that the method returns. Pass the instance as an argument to another method, assign the instance to a variable, or remove the call if it is unnecessary.
